abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the China Fourth National
            Highway Project were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory,
            the risk to development outcome was low or negligible, the
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            1) there is no particular advantage in combining two
            provinces into one project; 2) studies dealing with matters
            beyond the control of the provincial communications
            departments (PCDs) have little relevance; 3) when reforms
            are incorporated as part of project preparation, it takes
            longer to prepare the project; 4) procurement award to the
            lowest bidder can create problems, in spite of the
            prequalification process; and 5) putting subgrade and
            pavement implementation in the same contract is questionable.

442047.trustfund:
TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS,TF035665-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,
            HUBEI PROVINCE,TF035321-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,TF034269-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY
            III&IV PROJECTS,TF032238-CHINA - TRANSPORTATION,TF029709-PHRD-CHINA NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV (REC-EXE),TF029449-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS IV PROJ. (NH4)(BANK-EXECUTED),TF023092-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS II (BANK-EXEC.)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth National Highway Project for
            China aims to increase economic activity along the
            Wuhan-Changsha high-priority transport corridor through
            relieving congestion, facilitating trade and mobility, and
            increasing efficiency and traffic safety in Northern Hunan
            and Southern Hubei. There are four project components. The
            first has several subcomponents including construction of
            two expressway sections; building of interconnecting and
            other roads; supplying equipment to control construction
            quality and environmental monitoring, to operate and monitor
            the new expressway sections, and maintain the provincial
            road network; and construction supervision services. The
            second component funds studies and technical assistance in
            highway maintenance management, transport and trade
            integration, expressway commercialization and
            corporatization, and road safety as well as staff training
            programs covering all aspects of highway planning, design,
            construction, operation, finance, and maintenance. The third
            component funds the front-end fee while the fourth component
            finances land acquisition and resettlement.

440995.trustfund:
TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS,TF035665-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,
            HUBEI PROVINCE,TF035321-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,TF034269-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY
            III&IV PROJECTS,TF032238-CHINA - TRANSPORTATION,TF029709-PHRD-CHINA NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV (REC-EXE),TF029449-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS IV PROJ. (NH4)(BANK-EXECUTED),TF023092-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS II (BANK-EXEC.)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth National Highway Project
            Resettlement Plan (RP) contains two volumes. Volume 1 covers
            the RP of the construction of the Tucheng-Changsha section
            in Hunan, which will affect 141 villages of 28 townships of
            5 counties. Volume 2 is the RP of the construction of the
            Zhengdian-Tucheng section in Hubei, which will cover 68
            villages of 19 townships of 3 counties. The resettlement and
            rehabilitation implementation plans of both provinces
            include house construction, infrastructure relocation, job
            creation, compensation and rehabilitation of affected
            enterprises and public buildings, rehabilitation of
            vulnerable groups, and community rehabilitation. Both RPs
            reported that the project resettlement programs were
            prepared through participation of project affected people.

display_title.display_title:
China - Fourth National Highway
            Project : Hubei province

439896.trustfund:
TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS,TF035665-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,
            HUBEI PROVINCE,TF035321-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,TF034269-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY
            III&IV PROJECTS,TF032238-CHINA - TRANSPORTATION,TF029709-PHRD-CHINA NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV (REC-EXE),TF029449-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS IV PROJ. (NH4)(BANK-EXECUTED),TF023092-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS II (BANK-EXEC.)

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Highway IV Project includes
            the construction of (i) Tucheng-Changsha section in Hunan;
            (ii) Zhengdian-Tucheng section in Hubei; as well as (iii)
            interconnecting road programs in both provinces. For the
            Hunan portion, impacts of noise pollution will be mitigated
            by setting up acoustic barriers, building fencing walls and
            courtyard walls. Operation time of machines with intensive
            noise sources will be adjusted. Air pollution will be
            reduced by spraying water on roads being constructed and
            mixing equipment should be sealed. Ecological resources will
            be protected by avoiding to use farmland as earth borrow
            area. Water loss and soil erosion caused by deep-digging and
            high-filling will be mitigated by selecting wasteland and
            areas with sparse vegetation as concentrated earth borrow
            points. In Hubei, soil erosion can be prevented by planting
            grass or sod on slopes and cutting sites. Noise pollution
            will be reduced by proper maintenance of machines. Similar
            measures as in Hunan will be adopted to minimize noise and
            air pollution in Hubei. Water pollution will be mitigated by
            constructing temporary channels or conduits for irrigation
            and drainage. Vehicles carrying hazardous materials will be
            asked to take designated routes and parking lots.

441161.trustfund:
TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS,TF035665-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,
            HUBEI PROVINCE,TF035321-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV,TF034269-CHINA - NATIONAL HIGHWAY
            III&IV PROJECTS,TF032238-CHINA - TRANSPORTATION,TF029709-PHRD-CHINA NATIONAL HIGHWAY IV (REC-EXE),TF029449-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS IV PROJ. (NH4)(BANK-EXECUTED),TF023092-PHRD-NATIONAL HIGHWAYS II (BANK-EXEC.)

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Highway IV Project includes
            the construction of (i) Tucheng-Changsha section in Hunan;
            (ii) Zhengdian-Tucheng section in Hubei; as well as (iii)
            interconnecting road programs in both provinces. For the
            Hunan portion, impacts of noise pollution will be mitigated
            by setting up acoustic barriers, building fencing walls and
            courtyard walls. Operation time of machines with intensive
            noise sources will be adjusted. Air pollution will be
            reduced by spraying water on roads being constructed and
            mixing equipment should be sealed. Ecological resources will
            be protected by avoiding to use farmland as earth borrow
            area. Water loss and soil erosion caused by deep-digging and
            high-filling will be mitigated by selecting wasteland and
            areas with sparse vegetation as concentrated earth borrow
            points. In Hubei, soil erosion can be prevented by planting
            grass or sod on slopes and cutting sites. Noise pollution
            will be reduced by proper maintenance of machines. Similar
            measures as in Hunan will be adopted to minimize noise and
            air pollution in Hubei. Water pollution will be mitigated by
            constructing temporary channels or conduits for irrigation
            and drainage. Vehicles carrying hazardous materials will be
            asked to take designated routes and parking lots.

China - Fourth National Highway
            Project (Vol. 7) : Hubei - environmental impact statement
